channel.title: Ports not opening
channel.description: Been trying to get my server online for some friends to try out, but it always says my port is closed. I already port forwarded, set the in/outbound rules in the firewall etc and nothing is working.

item.title: Ports not opening
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“1 2 3 4 KOED, post:6, topic:551159”]Windows 8.

Default Gateway- 192.168.1.254
Subnetmask- 255.255.255.0
IPv4- 192.168.1.132

I was originally using my router which was connected to my modem/router, but now I am just connected to my original modem/router and still can’t get it to work. Not sure what else to do. Had someone take a look at it, but we couldn’t figure out the problem.[/quote]

If you were connected through both, they would both need to be configured. Where the one closest to your server would need to be configured to portforward to you, and the farther configured to send to your router(i believe). I never built a nested system server ;P. Try it with just one to start for sure. Hope someone one here knows about windows 8 and can make sure you have everything correct on your end. Is the top level router the Netgear R6300? or was that secondary one?

Might find this useful when you switch back to your two layer.
http://portforward.com/help/doublerouterportforwarding.htm

Read full topic

item.title: Ports not opening
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

open command prompt -> type netstat -all
Find the one that connects to your router.

Ethernet adapter Local Area Connection:

Connection-specific DNS Suffix . :
Description . . . . . . . . . . . : Name of the device you obtain your connection through
Physical Address. . . . . . . . . : YOUR MAC ADDRESS
DHCP Enabled. . . . . . . . . . . : No <-- if this is yes. then you do not have a static address.
Autoconfiguration Enabled . . . . : Yes
Link-local IPv6 Address . . . . . :-
IPv4 Address. . . . . . . . . . . : YOUR_LOCAL_IP_IS_HERE [write this down]
Subnet Mask . . . . . . . . . . . : MASK_FOR_NET_DECLARATION [most likely 255.255.255.0, if not write it down]
Default Gateway . . . . . . . . . : IP_YOU_CONNECT_TO_ROUTER_WITH[Write this down too]
DHCPv6 IAID . . . . . . . . . . . : -
DHCPv6 Client DUID. . . . . . . . : -

DNS Servers . . . . . . . . . . . : PRIMARY_DNS [write this down]
SECONDARY_DNS [write this down]
NetBIOS over Tcpip. . . . . . . . : Enabled

What version of windows do you have?

Ensuring you have a static ip will save so much headache in the future.

Read full topic

item.title: Ports not opening
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Make sure your local IP address is a static IP.
Most routers will set the local one (The one you use to portforward) every time the computer restarts, or when it’s lease is up (Default lease is approx. 2 weeks). Setting it to static in the windows network and sharing may work, but other devices may renew their IP addresses and take the same address, which will cause a conflict and both devices will not be able to use the internet very well. So, you need to set it to static in your router. This is router dependent, and you gave us no information on your router nor modem.

Read full topic

item.title: Ports not opening
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

You need to make sure your router allows anonymous internet requests. I have a linksys, that was my problem ._.

Read full topic
